title: University Secretary Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: An interview was scheduled with HR or online? I met the department folks at the panel interview. Three staff members from the dept and one staff member from another department asked preplanned questions as we sat around a conference table. Pretty low-key. Very comfortable.
Interview Questions: Scenario: You don't know what to do, so what do you do?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: Thorough, intuitive, inquisitive, friendly, helpful. I felt they were very detailed, and I like how they interviewed "themselves" to make me feel like I belong. I would recommend most people to consider applying for a job.
Interview Questions: What is your starting salary?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: Good quick easy simple and fine. Fast process. Lasted less than two weeks. Good good good. easy, good interview, quick, one call max. simple. online. chat via zoom. with professor or professors,
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 8 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: I submitted my application online through their portal, and was contacted some months later to set up an initial, first-round phone interview. A second round interview followed about a month later. I kept in touch every few weeks, but I did not hear back from committee for three months. I had to decline their offer because I already accepted another offer. Interviews were pleasant, administration was slow.
Interview Questions: Describe your research and teaching experience?

title: Front Desk Volunteer Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: As a front desk volunteer, I enjoyed greeting visitors, answering phones, and assisting staff. It was a great opportunity to improve communication and customer service skills while supporting a meaningful cause.
Interview Questions: Hello, how are you today?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: Very relaxed. I met with the professor and he was very acute in defining the scope of our objectives for the semester. It took him a while to get back to me but the benefits were great!
Interview Questions: He just wanted to know about my professional history.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2022
Interview Descriptions:
The interviewer introduced themselves one by one
Briefly introduce yourself
Questions about your past working experience
Questions about the project
What will you bring to this project
Are you available to come to the campus
Raise your own questions
Interview Questions:
How do u handle student conflicts in your past experience?
How do you convince students to work for public sectors after graduation?

title: Front Desk Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: Say your answer confidently and smile throughout the interview. Maintain eye contact with hiring manager. You will get the job if you assure them some relevant past work experience that you have done it before.
Interview Questions: Do you prefer to be leader or follower?  Tell me your 4 strengths? Why do you think you will be a great fit for this role?

title: Agent Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: The interview process is a multi-stage process for hiring new employees. The interview process typically includes the following steps: writing a job description, posting a job, scheduling interviews, conducting preliminary interviews, conducting in-person interviews, following up with candidates and making a hire.
Interview Questions: Do you have a reliable vehicle?

title: Tech Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: very good. behavioral mostly. Questions were related to leadership everyday work culture. It was a short interview and they asked me how comfortable I am with customer service experience. The offerered me a job right there.
Interview Questions: Leadership experience and what do you do when you need help.

title: Compliance Officer Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2020
Interview Descriptions: One telephone interview with the Director of the Office for Institutional Equity and Chief Compliance Officer, in person panel/ committee interview, and presentation. The presentation topic was "culture of compliance" and approximately 20 minutes.
Interview Questions: Tell us about your experience conducting research on how other Universities have implemented their compliance programs?

title: Internship Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was a multiple interview process.  They would have the search committee which was comprised of 3 or 4 people interview candidates first on the phone.  Once they narrowed down who they were interested in they would then invited you for a skype interview.
Interview Questions: Tell m about yourself

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: After application, I got an e-mail from my supervisor and set up a time for an interview. I was abroad at the time, so I appreciated the supervisor being understanding of the time difference and location disparity. We scheduled phone call interview at a mutually acceptable time.
Interview Questions: Are you able to act independently as necessary?

title: Academic Advisor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: It does take time. I did not have a screening interview. I was contacted to set a date. Met with the hiring manager and team. A few weeks later I received the offer of employment.
Interview Questions: Behavioral questions. Also, several student support based questions.

title: Student Caller in Alumni Fundraising Campaign Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2017
Interview Descriptions: Excellent! I found this to be an simple, direct position that helped raise money for our school. The interview outlined all of the most important job components and it was a wonderful experience.
Interview Questions: What do you love most about the University of Memphis?

title: VP of Corporate Engagement Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2017
Interview Descriptions: This was for a senior position and they conducted the interview as if I was straight out of college. I don't think they reviewed my resume, based on the questions that were asked.
Interview Questions: Describe your most difficult situation

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2017
Interview Descriptions: I interviewed with half the staff from my department. The director of the program was not in attendance, but made the final decision. The setup was fairly intimidating, but you can hold your own if you speak up.
Interview Questions: What is your previous job experience and how did that bring you here to the U of M?

title: Graduate Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online and got an email regarding scheduling interview then had an interview one on one and heard response next day with an offer. The process is not that difficult it is just depends on when the professor is available and how much time they have to get back to you.
Interview Questions: Previous experience

title: Local Technical Support Provider Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was not too difficult.  The director called me himself to ask if I was interested in coming in for an interview. It was one group interview with the director and about 4 members of his team.
Interview Questions: Tell me about yourself? (questions like this)

title: Desk Attendant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN)
Interview Descriptions: It was informal, and the Assistant Area Coordinator (AAC) was trying to get an understanding of your personality and your work ethic. The AAC is personable and see if you can fit into the work environment. The basic thing is that the person being interviewed will be a good fit for the company.
Interview Questions: What about work history?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: I contacted a professor while applying in a graduate program. We had regular communications over e-mail to explore potential research topics. The professor was satisfied and recommended me for an admission.
Interview Questions: My professor asked me to explore research topics related to biological literature mining.

title: IT Support Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 days. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2015
Interview Descriptions: The hiring process is simple and easy. You will have to just sell yourself of how you would be a good part of the company.The campus is completing projects of making it more eco friendly. So this makes it a campus of empathy and efficiency. The order of operations is great and staff on campus is friendly. It doesn't matter where you are on campus you're going to have a great experiences!!
Interview Questions: Basic interview question

title: Student Worker Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jul 2015
Interview Descriptions: When filling out the FASA I said I was interested in a student-worker job, used the online search for student worker positions, went in to the office and said I was interested. I had my resume and gave to the office coordinator and was called like the next day. Talked to the Office director for about five minutes and was hired. Filled out paper work with the coordinator and started the first day of school
Interview Questions: Why do you want to work here?

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: It was a Skype interview with the professor. It was very nice with out any stress and it went well for me. We discussed the research projects that I worked on in the past.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Research Technician II Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: 2 interviews- (this was 12 years ago. Note that below they only go back to 2010)  1 in HR, 1 by hiring PI. They were nice, fair, asked questions about past research, future plans, etc. They seemed to decide very quickly and they kept their word on the callback. Also kept word on subsequent salary raise based on performance.
Interview Questions: They asked about my educational aspirations. I wanted to attend graduate school, but did not want to put them off hiring me. Finding a balanced answer was tricky.

title: Graduate Student/Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2014
Interview Descriptions: I met with one of the counselors. I was contacted via email and showed interest in the position. There were a few follow up emails, phone calls, etc. I then met the professor I would be working with primarily in person.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to be at Memphis?

title: Receptionist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions: The interview was a very smooth and fun experience. Very good questions and how you carry yourself is very important: that is, attire and manners. As a receptionist, they expect you to be professional, so no makeup.
Interview Questions: What hours are you able to work?

title: IT Technical Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2014
Interview Descriptions:
It's usually in a computer lab in one of the campus buildings. You will first be asked to introduce yourself.

Then you will take a typing test. The minimum they require is 40WPM for the IT Technical Assistant position.

After this, you will be asked to go on eCourseware to write a short essay on how to troubleshoot something as well as a quiz on computer terminology and customer service. If I recall you will need to score at least an 80% to be considered further.

After you're done with the eCourseware portion they may do one of two things.

1. You can leave and they will determine who they want to hire over the next couple of days. This might happen if they schedule the interview during busy times.

2. They'll ask you to sit quietly, and once everyone is done, two of the supervisors will leave the room and call 2-3 people out for a small Q&A at a time until they cover everyone. You'll probably be asked one question only. If they do this, chances are good that they will announce who they will hire after everyone has been called. As for the types of questions, it varies greatly. If you boast about your technical still they'll probably ask you how to troubleshoot something. If they notice something in your job history that's a bit unusual, they'll ask about that.
Interview Questions: Did you leave your last place of employment on a happy note?

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2013
Interview Descriptions: I am International Student. I got admitted in the Graduate school for Masters Degree in Computer Science, University of memphis for Fall 2013. I had Applied for the Graduate Assistant Position in the August. I got the Assistant ship in the last week of August. There was no Interview for this postion.
Interview Questions: There is no interview for this position.

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 6 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis
Interview Descriptions: Typical university, long and drawn out
Interview Questions: Is entrepreneurship important?

title: Research Tech II Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: Applied online, received email from hiring manager. Scheduled interview. Interview consisted of a few faculty members, as well as staff. It was relaxed with little technical questions about my knowledge of the job skills needed. Received a call offering the position. Then dealt with HR to complete background checks, etc. Once everything cleared I was offered a menial salary and great benefits and a start date. I chose this job over another offer for significantly more money bc of the university environment and the great benefits.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Administrative Associate I Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jun 2013
Interview Descriptions: It was easy and not challenging. Comfortable atmosphere and I felt the interviewer was easy to communicate with. I also felt that the University of Memphis Human Resources department was great and they emailed frequently with me through the whole processs. Will be applying to another job there soon.
Interview Questions: Why did you apply to this job posting?

title: Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2013
Interview Descriptions: Submitted an application online. About two weeks later I was contacted via email to set up a phone interview with the hiring manager. They told me they would be in touch in a week or so. About a week later I was offered a final interview and flown to Memphis and put up in the campus Holiday Inn. The final interview was a full-day affair, I met with like 5 different people.
Interview Questions: It was all pretty standard, nothing out of the ordinary for an administrator.

title: Project Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: I received an email and an onsite interview was wet. The director asked questions and the interview went well. Then followed by background check and offer. It took almost 2 months for the whole process.
Interview Questions: The previous experience.

title: Research Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2013
Interview Descriptions: Interview with main advisor and department head over phone for graduate degree options; It is a general required process to apply for graduate school as well as scholarship. Need to go through the CV and research statement.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to apply for the research assistantship

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at University of Memphis in Jul 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied as a graduate, got selected for the program. Was interviewed by my advisor in person. Shared research interests and he liked my previous academic record and appointed me as a GA
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Desk Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: It was the basic interview, and no real tricks were employed in terms of assessing the potential of the candidate. That AAC, who is no longer with the Residence Life department, was incredibly professional and instrumental in reforming the culture of the building I worked. The process featured a one-on-one style question and answer session.
Interview Questions:
Q: What are your biggest strengths and weaknesses?
Q: Describe your organizational management.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis in Apr 2012
Interview Descriptions: Applied to the university. Got offer. Need to submit transcript, gre, toefl score. Also submitted international degree evaluation. Emailed several time to expedite processing. It took around 2 months total.
Interview Questions: I had to submit resume, GRE,TOEFL score, transcript.

title: Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 days. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Aug 2011
Interview Descriptions: It was simple, sent in resume and did one interview. There wasn't any unnecessary steps to the process, I was called in 3 days of sending in my resume and having my interview.
Interview Questions: what qualities to have that will assist me in holding this position?

title: Graduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through a recruiter. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Apr 2011
Interview Descriptions: Telephone interview that took place with two other people who would be higher up in the department. They were friendly enough but not very informative regarding the job itself. I would have liked to have learned more specifics.
Interview Questions: Why are you the best person for this job?

title: Administrative Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis in Feb 2010
Interview Descriptions: The interview process was pretty straight forward, however the actual job duties didn't match the job description.  This was a panel interview, consisting of three staff members because the director had retired several months earlier.
Interview Questions: The most difficult question is "what are your weaknesses".

title: Recruitment Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Oct 2009
Interview Descriptions: Initially submitted an application for a different position but was contacted by the Supervisor and encouraged to apply for the Recruitment Coordinator position instead. I submitted by resume, cover letter, and references. Within two weeks I was contacted to come in for an interview.
Interview Questions: all questions were fairly routine.

title: Graduate Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 months. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Jan 2009
Interview Descriptions:
Questions they will ask:
How have you taken a difficult situation and turned it into something else.  What was the outcome? 
Do you work better in teams or as an individual?
What is your strength? Weakness?
Interview Questions: IF you could be any animal what would that animal be?

title: Data Entry Interview
Application Type: The process took 1 day. I interviewed at University of Memphis (Memphis, TN) in Sept 2008
Interview Descriptions: sat in a one on one interview.
Interview Questions: Why should i higher you?
